meanings.definition: To make or become soaked with liquid.
meanings.sent1: After playing in the rain, my clothes sogs up.
meanings.sent2: The sponge sogs up the spilled water quickly.
meanings.sent3: The puppy sogs up the muddy puddle, turning into a little mess!
meanings.sent4: Her tears sogs up the tissue, making it fragile.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain sogs up the ground, creating a squishy mess.

meanings.sent1: The old towel is a sogs after being left out in the rain.
meanings.sent2: She stepped into a sogs of mud and struggled to lift her foot.
meanings.sent3: The sogs of wet leaves blocked the drain, causing a small flood.
meanings.sent4: The sogs of wet laundry made the basket difficult to carry.
meanings.sent5: The sogs of dough was too sticky to knead properly.
